programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 5/2/2021. At the dawn of the TV era in the 1950s, Steve Allen’s zany spontaneity turns Tonight into a hilarious and unexpected hit. But in the early 1960s, it’s Jack Paar’s captivating, quirky personality and Johnny Carson’s impeccably hip humor that transform late night from a shot in the dark into an enduring television staple.

programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 5/9/2021. Johnny Carson deftly navigates the turbulent 1960s to elevate The Tonight Show into a cultural touchstone, enshrining himself as the undisputed king of late night. But his success begets competition with the emergence of Dick Cavett, Merv Griffin, Saturday Night Live and an Indiana weatherman by the name of David Letterman.

programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 5/16/2021. As the 1980s dawn, David Letterman reinvents late night comedy for a new generation, rescuing comedian Jay Leno’s nearly flamed-out career in the process. But Johnny Carson’s enduring comic appeal spawns endless speculation over his eventual successor: will it be Leno, Letterman, Joan Rivers or upstart Arsenio Hall?

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 06/01/2014. Anthony Bourdain takes to the streets of Thailand, where he meets a local celebrity while on the hunt for some late-night grub.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 06/08/2014. A look at the dance/martial art of Capoeira, Bahia, the "African heart of Brazil," and Salvadoran fishing neighborhoods.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 10/04/2015. Bourdain and travel companion chef Eric Ripert visit France’s oldest city to experience its stew of cultures and cuisines.

programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 5/23/2021. Carson’s 1992 retirement touches a nation – and touches off an epic late-night war between Jay Leno and David Letterman. But it’s network newcomers Conan O’Brien and Jimmy Kimmel – and the comic inspirations of cable upstart Jon Stewart – that introduce hilarious new comedy perspectives that could change late night’s sense of humor forever.

programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 5/30/2021. As the 2000s unfold, Jay Leno’s monologue mastery captivates mainstream America. But his succession struggle with heir-apparent Conan O’Brien is no joke, making waves across the late-night landscape and bringing Jimmy Fallon’s fresh voice to the front. Thanks to cable’s rise, diverse voices like Chelsea Handler, Andy Cohen and George Lopez get their seat behind the late-night desk, while Jon Stewart and Stephen Colbert take the news into their own hilarious hands.

programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 6/6/2021. Jimmy Fallon takes over for Jay Leno. Stephen Colbert inherits David Letterman’s desk. Trevor Noah becomes a surprise pick for Jon Stewart’s replacement. Plus, new hosts James Corden, Seth Meyers and Samantha Bee join the late-night TV ranks. It’s a late-night free-for-all as this hilarious American institution confronts its biggest identity crisis in a generation thanks to streaming television and a highly polarized political landscape.

programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 5/2/2021. At the dawn of the TV era in the 1950s, Steve Allen’s zany spontaneity turns Tonight into a hilarious and unexpected hit. But in the early 1960s, it’s Jack Paar’s captivating, quirky personality and Johnny Carson’s impeccably hip humor that transform late night from a shot in the dark into an enduring television staple.

programme.title: The Story of Late Night
programme.desc: Aired 5/9/2021. Johnny Carson deftly navigates the turbulent 1960s to elevate The Tonight Show into a cultural touchstone, enshrining himself as the undisputed king of late night. But his success begets competition with the emergence of Dick Cavett, Merv Griffin, Saturday Night Live and an Indiana weatherman by the name of David Letterman.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/16/2023. Eva Longoria visits the northeastern state of Nuevo Leon, bordering her home state of Texas. As little grows there, and with meat on every menu, inventive and resourceful chefs transform simple ingredients into culinary delights.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/16/2023. Eva Longoria visits the northeastern state of Nuevo Leon, bordering her home state of Texas. As little grows there, and with meat on every menu, inventive and resourceful chefs transform simple ingredients into culinary delights.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/23/2023. Eva Longoria visits the state of Jalisco, where much of what is seen is quintessentially ‘Mexican’ originated. She also discovers that the state capital, Guadalajara, boasts some of the country’s most cutting-edge restaurants.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/30/2023. Eva Longoria explores the port gateway between Mexico and the rest of the world, Veracruz, and discovers that in its people remains a defiant spirit, still evident in their character, music, and the bold flavors of their food.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 4/28/2019. Kamau visits Dallas, TX - the home of the Megachurch, to find out what is creating the new face of Christianity today, in a city where church and state are far from separate.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 5/5/2019. While in and around Seattle, Kamau takes a look at different forms of activism that white people are using to combat America’s history of white supremacy and the rise of extreme right wing groups across the country.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.sub-title: Hmong Americans and the Secret War
programme.desc: Aired 5/12/2019. Kamau meets members of the Hmong community brought here after the Secret War forced their expulsion from Laos and learns the multi generational stories of loss, perseverance and hope that make up their American journey.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 5/19/2019. Kamau visits Jackson, MS to explore the divisive world of reproductive rights and reproductive justice including abortion, sex education, and women’s health.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 5/26/2019. Kamau takes a look at Washington D.C. through the eyes of the city’s residents who show him the vibrant culture of D.C. that is distinct from the Washington politics that surround it.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 6/2/2019. Kamau visits Salt Lake City, Utah, to explore the growing LGBTQ+ community living in the epicenter of the Mormon religion.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 6/9/2019. Kamau visits Milwaukee, WI--the most segregated city in America--to better understand why living while black can be so challenging

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 6/16/2019. Kamau visits Philadelphia and Chester, Pennsylvania to learn about the toxic man-made disasters that have polluted these communities for generations.
